page.title: 11CHARLTON HAMLET, HITCHIN
page.content: {CHARLTON}is a picturesque hamlet of 23 houses(pop.approx.40)lying just over 1 mile W of Hitchin town centre, and sited on the River Hiz. This attractive hamlet is one of Herts small village showpieces. One of the main attractions is the Windmill Pub which was named pub of the year 1979. It derives its name from a windmill which used to stand near to the pub until it was burnt down. The first known tenants to run an 'ale house' in Charlton came from Finsbury Park and sold corn and coal during the day and ale at night from a covered wagon. The windmill is occasionally the venue for sword dancers from nearby Offley. Sir Henry Bessemer was born in the house adjacent to the pub in 1813. Bessemer pioneered the large scale manufacture of cheap steel. He was knighted in 1879.
